qas.question: What determines which team gets possession first when extending a game to break a tie?
At which yard line on their opponent's side does a team take possession of the ball according to the CFL's tie-breaking rules?
In which year did the CFL begin requiring teams to attempt 2-point conversions after scoring in a tie-breaking situation?
Which round of tie-breaking is the last possible round in a regular season CFL game?
Which CFL games require tie-breaking rounds continue until a winner results?
After teams have completed their 2 point conversions, who is declared the winner?
If a game is tied at the end of a touchdown, what determines who takes possession?

plausible_answers.text: during the regular season the game ends as a tie

qas.question: After the coin toss if there is no winner during regular season what happens?

plausible_answers.text: it is required to attempt a 2-point conversion

qas.question: What is a team required to do after having a possession in the 2010 season?

plausible_answers.text: each team is given an equal number of chances to break the tie

qas.question: In the 2010 season if a game is tied what can each team do?

context: In the CFL, if the game is tied at the end of regulation play, then <b9_0>each team is given an equal number of chances to break the tie<b9_0/>. <b6_0>A <a0_0>coin toss<b6_0/><a0_0/> is held to determine which team will take possession first; the first team scrimmages the ball at the opponent's <a1_0>35<a1_0/>-yard line and advances through a series of downs until it scores or loses possession. If the team scores a touchdown, starting with the <a2_0>2010<a2_0/> season, <b8_0>it is required to attempt a 2-point conversion<b8_0/>. The other team then scrimmages the ball at the same 35-yard line and has the same opportunity to score. After the teams have completed their possessions, <b5_0>if one team is ahead<b5_0/>, then it is declared the winner; otherwise, the two teams each get another chance to score, scrimmaging from the other 35-yard line. After this <a3_0>second<a3_0/> round, if there is still no winner, <b7_0>during the regular season the game ends as a tie<b7_0/>. In a <a4_0>playoff or championship<a4_0/> game, the teams continue to attempt to score from alternating 35-yard lines, until one team is leading after both have had an equal number of possessions.
